ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I think Susan's theory is that learning is best done by trying but I struggled to apply the concepts welearned from the reading and in class to our individual cases. I think more discussion of the cases in the casebook in class would've been helpful. It was a lot to digest and a foreign subject for natural scientists and having Susan's support in breaking down how the analysis is performed would've been very valuable. That said, I did not try to go see Susan outside of class as she suggested, so that might've helped had I done so.

Prof. Clark was available for lengthy discussion outside of class and really invests herself into getting to know her students' backgrounds and goals with respect to the class material and their FES experience in general. Her dedication to her students is unusual and refreshing based on my time at FES thus far.The textbooks were very clearly written and helpful in grasping the policy sciences framework.
Very useful in identifying policy problems

The teacher is very cagey when trying to explain the concepts. Sometimes, when you ask her a question,she won't answer and just smiles instead. In the beginning, I thought the smile meant I had the right answer. I learned later that it meant that she was amused by my attempt at understanding the material. There are a lot of readings. Some are useful, some are not. The most useful things are the Policy Sciences handbook, readings that use the policy sciences to analyze a specific case, and then trying to apply the policy sciences to a case of personal interest.
Q12. The course is very specific and goes deep into studying a method for approaching environmental problems.

The material of this class is essential. The teaching was unlike anything I've ever seen before, and consequently, was strangely de-centering. The disparity between the value of the material, and the strangeness of the teaching in the classroom dominates the character of the class.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Discussions of the topics, hearing how other students approached the analysis.
The book provides a solid foundation of the policy sciences.
Policy science's framework
The Policy Sciences handbook and trying to de-code it with fellow students.
Learning a new method to approach environmental problems.
The readings were fantastic!! the journaling was very useful for developing thinking and understanding of the readings.
Extremely stimulating and deep material. Course really helps you improve the way you think, which not many courses ever do. Emphasis on true interdisciplinarity is very much appreciated.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The lectures were not always helpful.
The connection between the book and the class lectures was limited. Class lectures were unstructured and very difficult to follow.
Lecture Power points were often extremely reduddant.
Should be more organised
The teacher needs to try to explain things. When a student asks her a question about a concept, she needs to provide the answer.
The reading assignments were sometimes difficult to tie with the concept studied.

I would like the classroom to discuss the readings more. It respects a student to deal with the readings in class. otherwise, students are left wondering why they spent so much time reading, and how the reading fits into the material. especially in a class like this where the connections are not always obvious. The case book could be used better to explain concepts. this material is best understood in practice. since there is a limited degree to which we can be in 'practice' in one semester, in the classroom, the casebook seems like a logical choice for exploring concepts in practice.Also, communication in the classroom between the students and the instructor seemed disconnected. It felt like the instructor was often trying to explain the importance of the material, when the students already agreed the material was important, and were just trying to understand what the material was.

Reading materials and especially class time could be better organised.More direct and continuous feedback from instructor, especially regarding course journals, would be helpful.Course could spend less time 'selling' the policy sciences and more time e.g. on discussing and demonstrating their use.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: NA
There was no discussion section

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Very valuable course - has helped change how I think about natural resource management. Will definitely help me be more effective in the future.

This course could potentially be used as a tool to solve the problems we learn about in all of our other courses. Because the lectures and teaching is not strong, your ability to apply this course elsewhere is dependent on your ability to learn what you need through the book.
Policy framework will be useful tool at my work
This course is excellent for learning a framework for understanding and addressing complex problems.
I am interrsted in Policy Analysis. This is much more specific than the Policy foundations course.

This course gives me a way of thinking about ALL problem solving and ALL decision making I will encounter in the rest of my time at yale. As such, it is entirely valuable. This course offers a practice that can be used in the rest of my education here.

The course is about learning the policy sciences, and the policy sciences is about solving problems. For anyone and everyone whose objective is to solve problems of any kind, this course is highly relevant.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Interested in understanding the policy sciences.
I took this course because I wanted to learn about the policy sciences and how to apply it in my work both at F&ES and in my future career.
To discover another framework for approaching natural resource problems.
Natural resource policy professionals have lots to gain from this course
I wanted a better way to understand and address complex problems.
I am interested in Policy Analysis.
Because I am here to learn about how policy is made, and how to assess whether policy will be effective. This class fulfills on that goal.
The problem-solving framework of the policy sciences seemed interesting and in line with much of my existing thought, and therefore the course seemed worth doing.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes.

No. While I learned the policy sciences, this was dependent on my ability to learn from the book. In order to really understand the policy sciences, I would need a more structured, thorough discussion in class.
Yes.
Yes
Yes.
Yes.

Mostly yes. I would have liked to go deeper into the material in the class. I felt like we spent a lot of time discussing why the material is important, rather than discussing the material itself. I also thought we spent a lot of time on the instructors various decision seminars instead of the material. The knowledge/skills met my expectations in terms of its value, but I would have liked to have a community in the classroom where we could discuss the material in more detail.

More or less. The policy sciences framework is about as useful as anticipated. I feel familiarised with, but still not completely proficient in, the use of the framework. More practice / feedback would be good.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantage (for other groups) was support in performing the analysis andwriting the case.Disadvantage in my group was one group member who didn't want to work with the other group members and actively worked to prevent us from working together. VERY frustrating, but I think that was just one person and not true for the other groups.
The advantages of the group work in this course was the ability to talk to other students about what theywere learning. There were no disadvantages.
Group works useful

The advantages were having other people to discuss the concepts with and try to apply them to real-life cases. The disadvantages were that not all members of the group were interested in participating in the group.
The little group work was excellent. In groups we could explore the material together, which we did not have an opportunity to do in the classroom.
Discussing course concepts and material with fellow students was an excellent way to consolidate and further develop ideas and understandings about the material.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Read the casebook - the reading list is heavy but reading through other cases can really help you develop an understanding of how to perform the analysis.
Be prepared to take your learning into your own hands and be aggressive in class discussion if you have something in particular you would like to discuss/learn.
I would not recommend this course.
Those working as natural resource managers and policy makers have lots to learn from this course

Really try to understand each section of the policy sciences as the course progresses. If I were to do it again I would completely outline each section of the Policy Sciences for my case while we were discussing that section in class. This would save a lot of time when trying to write the final presentation and paper.
Its a very specific course because it focuses primarily on the Policy Sciences Framework. However, is method is very valuable and can be used for addressing multiple environmental problems.
Take the course, and put a lot of energy into the readings and the journaling. Be ready for a very unconventional, and perhaps frustrating classroom experience.

The course is ultimately very helpful and rewarding, but it will not seem like it for the longest time. Be prepared for a lot of confusion and wondering what's going on and questioning what on earth you're doing. Class sometimes felt a bit like therapy - confusing, unclear, and painful for the brain, but ultimately with a purpose, even if not immediately apparent. Trust that it will be helpful in the end.
